title: Custom Form Validator
description: Build an Angular reactive form with a custom validator that checks two fields match (e.g., password and confirm password).

description.summary: Build a simple counter using Angular's standalone components and signals. Add increment, decrement, and reset buttons. Disable the decrement button when the counter is at zero, and display the count in a child component.

arguments.name: signal()
arguments.desc: A reactive state variable from Angular's reactivity model, used to store and update the count.

arguments.name: computed()
arguments.desc: Used to create derived reactive values such as whether the count is zero.

arguments.name: Standalone components
arguments.desc: Both the main AppComponent and DisplayComponent are standalone components using 'imports' instead of NgModule.

arguments.name: Input binding
arguments.desc: The parent component passes the current count to the child DisplayComponent via an @Input property.

arguments.name: Event binding
arguments.desc: The buttons call increment, decrement, and reset methods using (click) handlers.

returns.desc: A minimal Angular counter app that demonstrates reactive state updates with signals.

examples: User clicks '+' → counter increases by one.
User clicks '−' → counter decreases by one (unless it’s already zero).
User clicks 'Reset' → counter returns to zero.
